intro: Korthalsia paludosa, commonly known as the swamp korthalsia, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, often with a fragrant aroma. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptic, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Korthalsia paludosa thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in marshes and swampy areas.
